str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To slay, kill by violence, slaughter, wound mortally. A primary verb; to butcher or to slaughter, or, to maim.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Four. Or neuter tessara a plural number; four.
An animal, living creature. Neuter of a derivative of zao; a live thing, i.e. An animal.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
From a primary kar; a horn.
And, even, also, namely.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
Wind, breath, spirit.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
